duties, like posting job ads, coordinating interviews and contacting candidates. Following our training sessions, you will also be able to assist HR managers in the life cycle recruitment (e.g. onboarding process for new hires and candidate sourcing.)

column62:
Talent Acquisition
 
 Establishing a strong rapport with hiring managers at headquarters and in international field offices to understand their strategic staffing needs and fill vacancies in a timely manner. 
 Ensuring clear mutual understanding of staffing priorities and practical constraints. Guide the hiring managers through the recruitment process where needed.
 Managing communications between applicants, hiring managers and others to keep all parties apprised of the status of each search.
 Working with hiring managers to develop job descriptions and announcements, post advertisements in a variety of newspapers, list-serves, trade publications, networks, etc. including internationally focused sources. Recommend creative and alternative advertising venues and strategies.
 Review online applications, evaluate qualifications of both internal and external candidates, conduct prescreen interviews to analyze candidate experience and fit, coordinate pre-employment tests as needed, and develop a short list of potential candidates.
 Present fully-screened qualified candidates to hiring managers in a timely manner and coordinate interviews. 
 Manage candidate interview results and selection decision with hiring manager. Provide candidates feedback on interview results as appropriate.
 Participate in the offer process including negotiating offers with candidates.
 Prepare offer letter/employment agreement for signature.
 Liaise between new hires and human resources, ensuring submission of all documentation required.
 
 Proactive Sourcing
 Recommend system improvements to current recruitment processes to ensure streamlined, cost effective, high quality services are provided to hiring managers.
 Track applicant flow, maintain pipeline of qualified candidates for future consideration, help collect and analyze recruitment data.
 Build and maintain database of qualified professionals to rapidly respond to talent management needs.

column34:
We at Simplifying Skills are focused on developing skills required to get good jobs in IT industry. The current curriculum heavily falls short in that. Hence, we have designed a skill development Programme that will compensate for all those short comings. Our Programme solely focuses on getting the best jobs available in the market right at the entrance level. This also clears the path to a successful and directed career in the industry. Our programme will train in the latest and most in demand skills in the industry. The training will not be a text book based rather real time concepts of the industry. During the entire training process students will get the look and feel of the corporate culture. It will prepare students for future Job interviews. With their increased exposure to the gamut of Industry and additional analytical skills they will crack the interview easily in comparison to the others who compete.
 My responsibilities in simplifying skills are to collaborate with the IT companies and campuses.
 *Conduct prescreening interviews
 *Maintain all pertinent applicant and interview data in the Human Resources Information System (HRIS).
 *Assist in interviewing and selecting employees onsite.
 *Browsing social networking sites like LinkedIn for suitable job profiles with required skills
 *Communicating by phone, email, and in person with job candidates to figure out things like availability and hiring timelines

Most CEOs in the world agree that Human Resources are the most essential and complex parts of a business. From start-ups to MNCs, managing human talent is art and science in itself which has fascinated me for the longest time. 
 
 Being a BBA graduate and currently pursuing MBA from the esteemed Chandigarh University, I have grasped experience in the domain of Human Resources Management through different internships including one at Cvent india. 
 
 As I gained a glimpse of practical knowledge and the adoption of textbook concepts into the real-life, I also sharpened my skills from software skills to interpersonal and communication skills. As a quick learner, I aim to ace the game with application of employee relations, performance management systems, organizational effectiveness, performance improvement, and employment retention.
 
 I would like to add value to an organization by mapping the changes in the industry and allow organizations to remain relevant in the competitive environment.

column34:
I have more hands-on role and are responsible for the day-to-day planning and execution of the high-level strategies of the HR department, plan and develop new recruitment strategies,staff benefits, and more.Â Finding and hiring the right talent is a very complex process. Modern HR managers do more than just posting job requirements in portals to fill open positions. They develop strategic solutions to attract the right candidates to fulfill the demands of the business.Â 
 
 From screening potential candidates on job portals andÂ social platformsÂ like LinkedIn to interviewing them, HR managers have to follow an organized approach for hiring the best suitable employee for the organization.Â 
 
 Once an applicant is selected, HR managers design offer letters and onboarding procedures. In case, a candidate backs out at the last moment, HR managers are bound to convince them to join the organization. If they still insist not to, HR managers need to repeat the hiring process to fill open positions.
